meanings.sent1: The fort was defendable against enemy attacks.
meanings.sent2: The castle had defendable walls to keep invaders out.
meanings.sent3: The defendable shield protected the knight from harm.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was as defendable as a sturdy fortress.
meanings.sent5: The defendable position on the hill provided a strategic advantage.

meanings.definition: Able to be protected from attack or criticism.
meanings.sent1: The password should be defendable from hackers.
meanings.sent2: The new software update made the system more defendable.
meanings.sent3: His defendable excuse for being late was quite creative.
meanings.sent4: She built a defendable wall around her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The defendable reputation of the company attracted many customers.
